title.narrative: COMMUNICATION

description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy and partnerships on child rights issues with stakeholders., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNICEF supported programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy and partnerships on child rights issueswith stakeholders.

description.narrative: During an exceptional year where the entire country faced the risks associated with the COVID-19 pandemic, extensive risk communication and public advocacy efforts contributed towards increased awareness about child rights and UNICEF’s contributions in response to the pandemic. Thirty-eight programme and donor initiatives were supported by the communication section to promote key strategic initiatives. The integration of digital platforms and a ‘digital first’ approach resulted in exceeded targets, with a 91 per cent increase in the success rate compared with 2019 for UNICEF Serbia social media channels, and an 81 per cent increase for U-Report Serbia social media channels | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2020
